snippet: The Affordable Care Act is reaching many people who have not had health insurance in years, if at all, and they are struggling to understand their policies.
abstract: Advocates of Affordable Care Act have moved to crucial new phase of implementation, making sure the eight million Americans who bought health insurance understand their policies and use them properly; support for the health care law will hinge at least partly on whether people have good experiences with their new coverage.
lead_paragraph: The Affordable Care Act is reaching many people who have not had health insurance in years, if at all, and they are struggling to understand their policies.

headline.main: Newly Insured, Many Now Face Learning Curve
headline.print_headline: Newly Insured, Many Now Face Learning Curve
